alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 20 at 10:11AM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Hastings NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River UNDER Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is expected. * WHERE...The Platte River near Darr, and for locations along the river from the Dawson-Lincoln county line to areas downstream near Lexington. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 10.5 feet early Thursday morning. Due to significant recent precipitation upstream along the South Platte River, particularly in Colorado, elevated water levels are gradually working their way east, along the Platte River in Nebraska. Minor flooding is expected along the Platte River beginning Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 07/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
